meanings.definition: Convert (a check or money order) into cash.
meanings.sent1: She was cashing her paycheck at the bank.
meanings.sent2: I will be cashing this check at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The magician was cashing in on his tricks for money.
meanings.sent4: The idea was so valuable, he was cashing it in for profit.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins cashing in the machine was music to her ears.

meanings.definition: To exchange (a coupon, voucher, or lottery ticket) for money.
meanings.sent1: He was cashing in his winning lottery ticket.
meanings.sent2: She will be cashing out her coupon for cash.
meanings.sent3: The kids were cashing in their toy vouchers for money.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity was like cashing in a golden ticket.
meanings.sent5: The cashier was busy cashing out all the winning tickets.

meanings.definition: To obtain money in exchange for (goods or services).
meanings.sent1: The artist was cashing in on her paintings.
meanings.sent2: They were cashing out their handmade crafts at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The dog walker was cashing in on the cute puppy service.
meanings.sent4: It felt like cashing in a treasure chest of valuable items.
meanings.sent5: The street performer was cashing out on his entertaining acts.
